comments:
Our new project wizard is trying to add a <filter> element to web.xml. I get
this exception occasionally in the resource perspective, but very consistently
in the J2EE perspective:

Changed to the jst.j2ee component since the API is there but I do not think this
can be classified as web.xml "editing" bug.

I see "com.bea.wlw.wls.webproject.core.util.WebXmlEdit", in your stack trace. 
We cannot recreate this.  Can you provide a better more descriptive scenario
that we can create in  a WTP only environment.

Chuck, can you have a look at this and unless you can associcate a meaning,  I
recommend closing this bug as a NOFIX - It seems it is created in a WTP extended
environment for BEA WebLogic workshop.

This only seems to happen while creating a project. We lay down a skeleton web
project, and add pieces from there based on what features were selected in the
wizard. At this point the web.xml being edited is essentially empty, it contains
this:

<web-app xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee
http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/web-app_2_4.xsd" version="2.4"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee">

    <display-name/>

    <description/>

</web-app>


A couple of servlets (actually beehive pageflows) have been code-gen'd into the
java source directory, and the apache beehive jars have been added to the
project classpath, and the apache beehive tld's have been copied into WEB-INF.

Could this have something to do with the fact that this code runs immediately
after creating the project, maybe a threading issue between it and some other
wtp job?

Hi - checking in on this bug - have you been able to reproduce this on a recent
Integration build or only 0.7 release....

(In reply to comment #6)
> Hi - checking in on this bug - have you been able to reproduce this on a recent
> Integration build or only 0.7 release....

We're on the 20050823 I-build, and I don't think it's happened since we moved to
this build.

(In reply to comment #6)
> Hi - checking in on this bug - have you been able to reproduce this on a recent
> Integration build or only 0.7 release....

I just saw this again today trying to create a web project off a clean
workspace. I'm also using the 20050823 I-build.
